items.title: Scary tech
items.summary: There is a vulnerability in trains where someone can remotely lock the brakes with a radio link, which railroad companies have known about since 2012 but have not addressed.

items.summary: Google is rolling out a fix for Gemini Live's blurry vision bug that was causing video feeds to appear low quality.

items.title: Coldplay's Chris Martin Concert 'Affair' Scandal — Married Astronomer CEO Could Stand To Lose a Fortune After 'Cheating' Kiss Cam Moment With Co-Worker
items.summary: Astronomer CEO Andy Byron could potentially lose a fortune after a scandal involving a 'cheating' kiss cam moment with a co-worker, despite his company being worth over a billion dollars. The scandal has also led to his wife removing his last name from her social life.

items.title: Centreon Extends Monitoring Reach into Observability Realm
items.summary: Centreon has expanded its monitoring capabilities by releasing an open source monitoring agent that integrates OpenTelemetry, allowing for unified monitoring and observability across IT and OT environments.

items.title: Amazon trims workforce in Cloud Division AWS citing rising AI-driven costs: Report
items.summary: Amazon is reducing its workforce in the Cloud Division AWS due to rising AI-driven costs, following CEO Andy Jassy's focus on automation to streamline operations.

items.title: Nothing Updates the Essential Space With 3 Big Improvements
items.summary: The Essential Space by Nothing has received 3 big improvements to differentiate its most recent phones, although execution may still need improvement. There is potential for further enhancements to optimize the Essential Space feature.

items.title: Waymo and Tesla Austin Robotaxi Competition

items.title: Kinder Morgan kicks off oil and gas earnings season with a bullish outlook, in part thanks to thirsty data centers
items.summary: Kinder Morgan's bullish outlook for oil and gas earnings is attributed in part to data centers, with the biggest driver of natural gas demand being exports and the rapid buildout of LNG terminals.

items.title: Why the Gates Foundation and Other Funders Are Spending $1 Billionon AI for Frontline Workers
items.summary: The Gates Foundation and other funders are investing $1 billion in a new entity called NextLadder Ventures to develop AI solutions for frontline workers such as public defenders, parole officers, and social workers.
